questions.text: Who was looking to buy a house?
questions.explanation:
Carla.

	Carla decided with all the children she had (6 at this point) she needed to get a house where there was room for everyone. She had a low budget to work with making it hard for her to find a house.

questions.text: What was one of the perks of Sam dating other women?
questions.explanation:
punishing Diane.

	All of those things might be considered perks, but Sam specifically mentioned that punishing Diane is a perk of dating. Diane was still trying to get Sam to propose to her again.

questions.text: Who was Sam going to go out with?
questions.explanation:
Tiffany.

	Sam was determined to keep dating women to show Diane he's not interested in her. Diane was not bothered by this and believes eventually Sam will come around and they will get married.

questions.text: Who found a house for the person who was looking for a house?
questions.explanation:
Cliff.

	Cliff saw a house while on his postal route and told Carla about it. Carla didn't believe it at first since she didn't have much money, but it turned out to be the right price.

questions.text: What did Carla say when Cliff said, "You're welcome."?
options: "I didn't ask for you to speak to me."
questions.explanation:
"Yuck, I knew you'd get mushy."

	Carla thanked Cliff for finding the house. However, she didn't want Cliff to respond because she didn't want a warm moment with Cliff since she dislikes him. Even "You're welcome" was a little bit too much for Carla to stomach.

questions.text: When was it a really bad time to mess with Carla?
options: When she told you to shut up
questions.explanation:
When she was happy.

	Cliff had bad news to tell Carla about the house and Norm warns him that it's always bad to mess with Carla but it's really bad when she's happy. Norm compared her to King Kong.

questions.text: Why was the person upset about the new house?
questions.explanation:
It's built over a graveyard.

	Carla was very superstitious. She believed if she lived in a house over the graveyard she would be haunted.

questions.text: Who got scared and leaves the house?
questions.explanation:
Norm.

	Norm told them, "Scary stuff, scares me." He then left the house leaving Cliff alone with Carla.

questions.text: Why did the person buying the house stay all night in it even though she was scared?
questions.correct: If s/he could get through the night it would be okay.
options: The person did not stay all night in the house.
S/he wanted to see if s/he could catch any ghosts.
questions.explanation:
If s/he could get through the night it would be okay.

	Initially Norm and Cliff went with her so she wouldn't be as scared, but as stated early Norm left early. She taught Cliff how to dance a little and then they ended up falling asleep. Carla was not happy she fell asleep on Cliff. Cliff claimed he didn't even enjoy it.

questions.text: Why was the house so cheap?
questions.explanation:
It was near the airport.

	Carla and Cliff heard the planes going over the house and realize that they were near the airport. Carla was excited that the house wasn't haunted after all.
